revised_title: Two Remarkable Cases of Surgery: Wounds and Paralysis
tldr: This article presents two remarkable cases of surgery, one involving a man with a severe eye injury and paralysis, and the other a man with a liver disease and gallbladder issues. The author, Mr. Francis Geach, details the treatments and outcomes of these cases, including the use of astringent frotts and the importance of proper wound care. These cases highlight the challenges and successes in treating complex medical conditions during the 18th century.
